answers.answer: hi,i have fungal infection about 3 weeks and still persist, doctor prescribe me cannestan and diprosone. Mix them together and apply on affected area, for me it helped and feeling much better.Try taking probiotics and yogurt. Maintain a diet with less sugar. I am no expert but just helping out.

Hello!   I think you may have balanitis cus you have it for so long already. I had balanitis for 1,5 years. First doctors told me it was a yeast infection but none of the creams and pills worked. Are you uncut? I'm asking cus this was the reason of my infections and redness in my penis head and foreskin. My problem solved with circumsicion.

question: Hi, sorry for double posting.I am a male. I contracted yeast infection on my penis about 9 months ago. Till today, it still comes and go regularly.However recently, the rash has been extremely persistent. I used several different cream prescribed by different doctors and pills too but it doesnt seem to be working.I had a urine test which tested negative for microbiological bacteria.Can anyone please advise me on what else other than yeast infection could i have possibly contracted? Or just that i need to change my medication.I have similar symptoms to yeast infection which are redness and itch. Several doctors i've seen have confirmed it to be yeast.But after so long and its still around, im beginning to worry.I have also tested negative for hiv and diabetes.I will greatly appreciate your kind assitance.Thank you.
title: Help with male yeast infection
